results.title: Restoration
results.brief_description: An old, frayed photograph depicts the image of a young domestic servant living and working on a NSW property in 1912. Using fragments of memory and ritual, Restoration gradually reveals the events behind the photo. Drenched in colour, this visually sumptuous work reveals that willing submission can disguse a fierce determination to change. In the abscence of any dialogue, the film employs a variety of innovative stylisitic techniques to convey narrative, including an evocative use of non-diegetic sound. The unconventional use of dance to depict the relationship between the maid and the photographer provides a memorable focal point of the film.

results.title: Responsible pet ownership
results.creator_credit: Department of Natural Resources and Environment
results.brief_description: This video contains some practical tips and useful information on the following areas of dog and cat ownership: choosing a pet; taking care of your pet’s health; general wellbeing; cat and dog registration; teaching children how to behave around dogs; knowing the signs of a frightened or threatening dog and more. Begins with five 30 second advertisements which were screened on national television in the year 2000 concerning responsible pet ownership and continues with two short videos on pet owners and their responsibilities to the animals.

results.title: Responsible assertion (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Shows assertive, unassertive and aggressive responses to certain situations. Talks about the rights of individuals in personal confrontations. Shows how to be responsibly assertive, instead of being aggressive or unassertive.

results.title: Responsibility: what limits? ('Those Callaways')
results.brief_description: Excerpt from the 1964 film “Those Calloways”. Presents a story about a man whose private dream of establishing a bird sanctuary interferes with commercial development of a hunting resort. Shows the conflict that arises when he takes the law into his own hands.

results.title: Respiratory and cardiac arrest
results.brief_description: Deals in detail with methods of resuscitation after heart failure during anaesthesia. It is treated in three parts: apparatus, respiratory obstruction, and cardiac arrest.

results.title: Respiration in man
results.brief_description: Living tissue and various instruments, techniques and experiments are used to illustrate the structure of the lungs. Movements of alveoli and blood in the vessels, gas concentration relationship, transport of 02 and C02, aortic and carotid bodies, and the function of carotid bodies are also shown. No other credits available.

results.title: Respecting differences (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Panorama Productions and New South Wales Government
results.brief_description: Shows the difficulties that migrant children have in adjusting to Australian schools and culture, especially non-English speaking children. Recently the New South Wales Government has given funds to support the teaching of ethnic languages in many state schools which helps facilitate adjustment to Australian life.

results.title: Respect for property
results.brief_description: A gang of boys break into a rival group’s club house and destroy much of the contents. Instead of seeking revenge, the boys who suffered the damage seek the help of a local policeman who explains to them the meaning of private and public property. They relate their own loss to the damage they have done on school property and realise that public property is owned by everyone and not just one individual.

results.title: Resources discovered
results.creator_credit: Beechdale Educational Films and Walter F. Broome
results.brief_description: The services which the public library can provide for industry and commerce. How in particular the smaller concern which cannot afford its own special library can through the public library have access to all the information resources of the nation. The way in which the librarian deals with the specific enquiries of different kinds it shown.
